column5: I'm gonna swear and it's gonna get edited.  that song is darn good!!  Edit: just listened to it a second time
Both songs are awesome

There seems to be a lot of interest in music from the members here. We already know that there are some very talented musicians in our midst but what about the others who are too shy to share their music or who have talented family members doing some recording?  My own family is quite musically inclined but I'm at the weak end of that chain. Not that I'm tone deaf or anything but I gave up the banjo in frustration years ago. If you hear some of my family's stuff you'll understand why.  Is anyone interested in posting samples for the rest of us to enjoy? Ice reports seem to be slowing down and it's still a few months till soft water is with us again so let's do a little bragging.  JF

I was just talking about this with my little one yesterday! She used to think that every dad played guitar, sang and had a rock band...lol. Here's a sample of some my favourite pieces...

O Holy Night...arranged by myself...and I play all the instruments. My "Pink Flyod" inspired work.



An acoustic song called "Midsummers Daydream" by Rik Emmett from Triumph. Not nearly as fluid and amazing as his version.


I have been playing amateur recording engineer with my band. This is our cover of Creep by Radiohead.


Finally, a duet with a good friend. Our cover of Teach Your Children by Graham Nash


If you want to see more, you can check out my youtube channel at http://www.youtube.com/user/ccmtcanada?feature=mhum
Hopefully BPSbassman sees this post and puts up his fishing video of him and the "fish guts"
CCMT !!! You've got talent man !! I enjoyed your versions as much as the originals.  great idea for a thread John
mercman, have you heard the OFC anthem?  come on cliff post it. please.

Every one of you has probably heard my little brother play. He worked on the HNIC theme for years as well as the Canadian Olympic TV coverage. Till he told me I didn't even realize there were guitar lines in the HNIC theme. He has often written and performed the background music for the Olympic athlete cameos you see on tv. When someone wins something he'll get a call in Stratford asking for the music for the vid asap. He works straight thru until it's done and dubbed on the vid, then he sends it to the network electronically for play. He also runs a small studio recording other artists.    Hit the play arrow and wait for the file to buffer. This is just a sample of his guitar playing.  Look up Ali Matthews for more of him accompanying her. He also does a lot of her recording and production as well as accompanying her when she does tv or live hows.  JF

CCMT: Man, you got talent on the guitar and your band meshes very well. Your guitar playing on Midsummer REALLY caught my attention. What kind of Acoustic is that?...sweet sound and looks like a fine piece. Again, I really enjoyed your videos!!
Cliff. Awesome stuff. "Teach your Children" with Hazel just blows me away. Thanks for reposting.

This is my old band's myspace page...the first two songs are off an album we cut last year. I sing, composed the songs and play rhythym guitar. I think most here would like "middle ground" over "sarcastic prizes".  http://www.myspace.com/calmforransom

Thanks guys!  Teach Your Children is for sure one of my favourties...it sounds great around a campfire too!  Rodcaster...the acoustic you see is a Fender Semi Acoustic...love that guitar! LOL  I took a listen to those songs and you have some serious talent as well!  I actually like both songs...very different and very creative....great job on them!
